definition:
Definition {#definition .unnumbered}
==========

A *metacyclic group* is a group $G$ that possesses a normal subgroup $N$
such that $N$ and $G/N$ are both cyclic.

Examples {#examples .unnumbered}
========

-   All cyclic groups, and direct products of two cyclic groups.

-   All dihedral groups (including the infinite dihedral group).

-   All finite groups whose Sylow subgroups are cyclic (and so, in
    particular, all finite groups of order).

Properties {#properties .unnumbered}
==========

and of metacyclic groups are also metacyclic.

Metacyclic groups are obviously supersolvable, with Hirsch length at
most $2$.
